plugin.description: Allows searches to be saved and re-run, to use more powerful search operators, and be done over specified time periods. Click link for more details and settings.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
1.4.0: adds first basic search-and-replace functionality. Adds case sensitive searching. Adds full-word searching.
1.3.0: adds `*` and `?` wildcard operators. Adds auto-refresh capability. Other improvements. (Please see documentation for details.)
1.2.4: fix /flexiSearch issues on iOS
1.2.3: change to allow /quickSearch from x-callback without search term.
1.2.2: ability to run FlexiSearch without closing the Dashboard and Project list windows from other plugins.
1.2.1: fix bug in /searchInPeriod. 1.2.0: multi-word search terms.
1.1: New 'flexiSearch' command. Adds limits to very large search results, to prevent overwhelming the app. Deals with 'twitter.com' case. Lots of other polish.
1.0: Major new release with more powerful search syntax, a new display style, sync-ing open tasks and more. Please see the README to learn more!

plugin.commands.name: quickSearch
plugin.commands.description: quick Search over all notes, showing results in a fixed Quick Search results note
arguments: terms to filter by paragraph type (separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: search
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search over all notes
arguments: terms to filter by paragraph type (separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: searchOpenTasks
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search over all open tasks in all notes
arguments: paragraph type filter terms (optional; separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: searchInPeriod
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search of specified tags or mentions over Calendar notes from a time period
arguments: start date to search over (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD). If not given, then defaults to 3 months ago
end date to search over (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD). If not given, then defaults to today
paragraph type filter terms (optional; separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: searchOverCalendar
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search of specified tags or mentions over all Calendar notes
arguments: paragraph type filter terms (optional; separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: searchOverNotes
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search over all project notes
arguments: paragraph type filter terms (optional; separated by commas)

plugin.commands.name: flexiSearch
plugin.commands.description: Save results from a search with the most flexible of options

plugin.commands.name: replace
plugin.commands.description: Search and Replace over Calendar notes

plugin.settings.title: Case Sensitive searches?
plugin.settings.description: By default searches in NotePlan ignore the case (capitalisation) of characters. This plugin will use case sensitive searching if this is turned on.

plugin.settings.title: Match on full words?
plugin.settings.description: By default searches in NotePlan match on parts of words. This plugin will only match on full words if this is turned on.

plugin.settings.title: Automatically save
plugin.settings.description: If true, will save to an automatically-named note in the configured folder, starting with the search terms.

plugin.settings.title: Folder name
plugin.settings.description: Folder to store any output files in

plugin.settings.title: /quickSearch note title
plugin.settings.description: note title for results for command /quickSearch

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of folders to exclude in these commands. If a folder is listed, then sub-folders are also excluded.
To exclude the top-level folder, use '/'. (The special Trash folder is always excluded.)

plugin.settings.title: Display style for search result lines
plugin.settings.description:
Choose the style to use:
- Normal 'NotePlan' styling, showing tasks, bullets and quotes, tweaked slightly for matching headings. You need to use this if you want to use the power of sync'd lines with the /searchOpenTasks command.
- Use 'Simplified' text, more like web search engine results.
Note: this affects some of the following settings.

plugin.settings.title: Result set size limit
plugin.settings.description: Result set size limit: if the search produces more than this, it will only return the first ones up to this limit.

plugin.settings.title: Heading level
plugin.settings.description: Heading level (1-5) to use when writing section headings in output

plugin.settings.title: Saved Search heading
plugin.settings.description: Text to append to headings in search results (optional)

plugin.settings.title: Sort order for results
plugin.settings.description: This controls the order that the results are displayed

plugin.settings.title: Group results by Note?
plugin.settings.description: This controls how results are displayed. If true, matches found within the same note are grouped together. If false, every match is shown with a note link at the end of the match.

plugin.settings.title: Prefix for search result lines
plugin.settings.description: String to put at the start of each search result line (where display style is 'Simplified'). Default is '- '. Can also be empty.

plugin.settings.title: Result quote length
plugin.settings.description: Length of matching line to quote in the search results. To always quote the full line set this to 0. Note: this only applies in the 'Simplified' display style.

plugin.settings.title: Highlight matching search terms?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to ==highlight== the matches in the result lines. (Works best when using a theme with highlighting.)

plugin.settings.title: Date style
plugin.settings.description:
Where the match is in a calendar note, choose where that link is shown as
- a 'date' using your locale
- an NP date 'link' ([[2022-06-30]])
- an 'at' date (@2022-06-30), or
- a 'scheduled' date (>2022-06-30).

plugin.settings.title: Default Search terms
plugin.settings.description: Optional list of search terms to use to pre-populate the search term box.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
